I'm hearing that before issuing a HTTP PUT request from JavaScript, more 
recent browsers are sending out HTTP OPTIONS on the request resource to 
verify that the PUT method is supported. If the OPTIONS request returns 
with a 200 OK and specifies that PUT is allowed everything is alright. 
If not the browser will not execute the PUT (whether or not the resource 
supports it). Is this sane behavior from a UA, to check for just one method?

Bill
